name: FogCatcher Inn

reviews.text: Just returned from a trip from San Francisco to LA. En route to LA we wanted to visit Hearst Castle and chose to stay at Cambria. Called on spec at hotel and what a great stroke of luck.
reviews.title: Great Spot - great hotel
Top 5 Reasons You Should Stay Here.
reviews.text: We got a garden view room (not sure about the garden view mind) with 2 queen beds for only round about $130. The room was great - nice size, immaculately clean, good furnishings and comfortable bed. Breakfast was good, bagles, cereal, waffles, fruit and pastries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was cold at night when we were there so it was great to have a fireplace in the room, which not only warmed the room up in the evening but also made it feel really cosy.
reviews.title: Perfect place!

reviews.text: The location was great, only 5-10 minutes up the road to visit Hearst Castle (which is definately worth a visit). The hotel is right across the road from the beach which has a nice boardwalk running along it.
reviews.title: little gem by the sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definately stay here again and recommend it to friends.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location

reviews.text: We stayed here for just one night on our 12 day vacation from San Fran to San Diego. We stayed here so we can go to Hearst Castle and we read great things about the town. Our room was big and cozy wth a fireplace and a view of the ocean. We walked on the boardwalk by the ocean and it was so peaceful and beautiful. Breakfast in the morning was way more than expected. The breakfast room reminded me of a country kitchen and they had eggs, sausage, waffles etc..It was a great night and one of the more relaxing and romantic nights of our trip. Hearst Castle was unbelievable. We took tour 1 and cannot wait to return. Definitely recommend this hotel and Hearst Castle to anyone.
reviews.title: Great cozy hotel wish we stayed longer

reviews.text: we were 2 adults and 2 children.
reviews.title: romantic stayaway

reviews.text: the room was lovely- with a fireplace, and the whole family enjoyed the room and the walk to the ocean.
reviews.title: Great waffles!!!

reviews.text: the aromatic soap is interesting- if you love it.
reviews.title: Wonderful!
Charming and Comfy Inn
reviews.text: we have already recommended it to our friends.

Just returned from a two-day trip from LA to Big Sur, staying one night at the Fogcatcher Inn en route -- an absolutely perfect base for exploring the coast and/or visiting Hearst Castle. The Fogcatcher is on the beautiful coastal strip of Moonstone Beach in the midst of several other motels/inns/B&Bs, and is a gem among them. The rooms are nicer than their website photos suggest, wonderful showers, furniture, fireplace etc., with one of the comfiest beds I've ever slept in. Highly recommended. (Check their website for special internet deals). Just down the road from the Moonstone Beach Bar & Grill, which is perfectly situated but with very hit or miss food.
reviews.title: Heavenly Beds

reviews.text: stayed one night as a stopover on the way from SF to LA as a base to see Hearst Castle (which is worth it if only to see how v.rich people can have v.bad taste!)
reviews.title: Good as a stopover

reviews.text: - Clean
reviews.title: Gone downhill a lot in a year

reviews.text: - Friendly helpful staff
reviews.title: What a wonderful location!
Beautiful Romantic and Conveinent
reviews.text: - good size rooms

reviews.title: Very Nice Stay!!
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Fog Catcher (March 24) during a drive down the coast from San Fran to LA - and found it to be a wonderful place to stay. Stayed in a Garden View Room for $84.00. My wife and kids loved the place - and thats saying alot! Wished we could have stayed longer. It was very quiet and appreciated the very comfortable queen size beds and spacious room. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. We had a ball walking the ocean boardwalk across the street on a beautiful sunny morning - kids rolled up their pants and played in the waves. The breakfast was great (can't believe how nit picky some people can be in some of the other reviews) - it had a good variety, including fruit, cereal, toast, waffles, etc. If we ever come through the area again we definetely will attempt to stay here again. It gets an "A" from us.

The reception upon arrival was polite to the point of rudeness. "May I help you" in a monotone is not the way to greet a guest. I had been on the road all day so I headed for the shower. The showers are supplied with pump dispensers of shampoo and conditioner. After I was in, I found both dispensers empty. No bottles anywhere, but while looking, dripping wet, I noticed a lot of hair in my sink and around the faucet handles. Down I went to the front desk where I was greeted by the same drone of "may I help you". The room was adequate. We had the ocean view room, but the window was small, and the room stuffy. The bed was average. For the price, this place does not present a value. I don't mind paying a premium rate, but I expect premium service. The buffet breakfast was awful, and I took the kids to a restaurant to get something healthy to eat. The gardens arount the pathways to the rooms are quaint.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Comfortable & Cuddly
reviews.text: My husband & I went for our birthdays with-out the children. The room & bathroom were clean and comfortable. Fire place was nice. It was a cuddly place. It's not your marble floors & crystal chanderlier hotel. Breakfast was better then the average bread/dry creal free breakfast. We would stay there again.
Stayed at FogCatcher over the Valentine weekend. What a wonderful place! Last time I was in Cambria I stayed in the Blue Dolphin and payed much, much more for nothing really much nicer.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!!

reviews.text: Cambria is worth a stop and this inn is a great place to stay at the end of your Big Sur or San Simeon road trip. You cannot miss the best Pan Asian restaurant, Wild Ginger (they'll give you a map) we've ever been in (and we've been in them all over the world). Great beds, great location, smallish pool, but so what? I'd return!
reviews.title: Peaceful, friendly, low pressure

reviews.text: Was not sure what to expect when my husband booked this. The person at the desk was very polite and helpful on the phone when we needed directions. He handed us warm cookies as we checked in. The rooms looked like quaint cottages from the outside and were tastefully decorated inside. There was a fireplace and quality linens on the bed. Breakfast the next morning had an excellent selection. Everything was wonderful.
reviews.title: Love this inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at the Fogcatcher twice--most recently in July 2008 and previously about two years before. The area is beautiful--one of the world's true works of art. The Fogcatcher Inn is along Moonstone Beach. It is probably the best place along there. There are lots of place, but some are certainly on the lower end. I think the Fogcatcher is nicer now than two years ago. It just seems to be "spruced up." I loved it two years ago--and love it more now. Compared to some hotels, it is rather basic. It is certainly not a 5 star place. It's a bit pricey, but--again--it is likely the nicest place in the area. It is is clean, well-kept. The rooms are rather spacious, and the service is great--as is the location. My only suggestion is to try to get a room away from the pool. The pool isn't that noisy, but there is some noise.
reviews.title: Beautiful place ...

reviews.text: The welcome we received from the front office was fantastic, really warm and lots of useful information, especially about local amenities and restaurants.
reviews.title: Fantastic welcome and location

likes.liked: — The great rooms, cleanliness and surroundings

reviews.text: The location is beautiful - the walk in front of the hotel is peppered with ground squirrels and then there are seals basking on the rocks, not to mention the rock pools.
reviews.title: Home sweet home

likes.liked: — The large and nicely decorated room

reviews.text: This room was very nice, comfortable bed, roomy, cute decor. When I pulled the curtains closed, the room stayed very dark which is nice when you want to sleep in. The ocean with a nice boardwalk is right across the street (no hotels directly on the ocean, across the street is as good as it gets). There are no good ocean views. The pool was small and on top of the parking lot. The continental breakfast was the usual cereal, toast, danishes, waffles, juice. The staff was very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: My husband had a business meeting in Paso Robles, so we decided to make a little vacation out of it. The FogCatcher was remarkable. The rooms were very nice and clean as well as extremely friendly, and helpful staff. They even brought us a little fan when the temps soared unepectedly.
reviews.title: Two Thumbs up!!!

reviews.text: What's even more great is, we got to bring our kitty, Cody. He had an excellent time as did we. I definitly recommend staying here!
reviews.title: Beautiful property, lovely stay

reviews.text: A lovely gem on the coast - we had an ocean view room and it was well worth it. Can hear the sea, the rooms are definitely high class, property neat and clean. Ask for an inflatable bed if you have teens (like we do) and need an extra bed.
reviews.title: perfedct room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free wifi, great breakfast buffet. This was the only property on the road (Moonstone) that had a No Vacancy sign out and there were many high end cars so I'd say many share my opinion!
reviews.title: Lovely, homely hotel

reviews.text: Loved staying on Moonstone Beach in Cambria. It was wonderful.
reviews.title: AHHHhhhhh Cambria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Fogcatcher in was ideal too. Front desk staff was great, very helpful. Gave us good suggestions on which wineries to visit along with free tasting cards.
reviews.title: Excellent with one small exception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was nice but a little small for 3 adult women, but was comfortable. The fireplace was a nice feature.
reviews.title: Great place for a getaway!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great, lots of options both hot and cold. Best breakfast spread I've seen.
reviews.title: Our favorite getaway......

reviews.text: Pool and hot tub were enjoyable... Just the right temp.
reviews.title: We loved the Fog Catcher Inn in Cambria, Ca!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was extremely kind and friendly, we were upgraded to a ocean view room, that made our day. They gave us cookies on check in, which was a nice touch. It was a cold day, so the fireplace was a welcome addition. But the windows in the room looked old and they let in a draft so I was still cold even with the fireplace on. Cambria is a very tiny town that I chose to stop in on our trip up the coast, it was beautiful but boring, I would have preferably stayed an extra day in Santa Barbara instead.
reviews.title: So cozy and romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, but average service and quality for the price. Other than location, nothing memorable.
reviews.title: Weekend on the coast

reviews.text: This place in Cambria, CA on Moonstone Beach is simply awesome! Went there on a family trip and it was just beautiful. Steps from the beach, the room had a "fireplace", comfy beds, and a fantastic full breakfast! It is a lovely place to stay and I highly recommend it! Also, the front desk personnel are super friendly and helpful!!
reviews.title: Fantastic place!!!

reviews.text: Great stop off point when travelling north from LA to San Francisco. Wonderful location just across from coastal path. Very comfortable rooms. Only slight critical observation was the breakfast room which was a bit simple and had a dreadful rolling news channel on a big screen.
reviews.title: very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff greeted us telling me that they had been waiting for us. We were given a comfortable and clean room across form Moonstone Beach. The staff recommended a restaurant which we ate at but didn't terribly enjoy. That was our fault. We were specific enough about what we were looking for. It was rather cold that night, so we put on the gas fireplace and remained in our room for the night. The next morning we enjoyed the best free breakfast ever, The selection and the food were excellent. We walked on Moonstone beach and saw much animal life. it's a beautiful walk to take. It's a place to go!!
reviews.title: Best place of all during our trip

reviews.text: My daughter and I were totally taken with the Inn. We reserved an Ocean front room with two queen beds. It wasn't advertised on the website but by calling and requesting we were able to arrange. Next time I'd probably try to reserve a room with a porch too, I'm not how charming the rooms in the back were. The staff were hospitable and helpful. Room was very clean and the fire-place was a nice touch. We both enjoyed the full breakfast. Very substantial and very good.
reviews.title: Lovely, Charming

reviews.text: We loved this spot! Even my husband, who is very hard to please, always mentions this place as one of his favourites of our family holiday. Breakfast was modest, served in plastic bowls etc, but still ok. Beds were very comfortable and the location was so peaceful. I loved the walk in the morning along the foreshore.... and we had a great meal at the pub just a couple of steps down the road. I would whole-heartedly recommend this place if you are stopping over to see the castles as a family like we were.
reviews.title: Excellent!!

reviews.text: We have had our family reunion here for the past 18 years. There is nothing bad to say about this Hotel. It just gets better every year. The staff are friendly. The rooms are clean. The breakfast is excellent. The location on the beach is outstanding. The sunsets are gorgeous.
reviews.title: Staying at the Fogcatcher

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a mile from town of Cambria.and ten minutes from Hearst Castle.
reviews.title: Delightful spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very welcoming and sincere which was a definite plus. The location is divine and very relaxing. The breakfast room was very attractive and the food exceptionally good. The room was clean and nicely decorated and included free bottles of water. The reception area was stocked with coffee and fruit. Everything gave the impression that The Fogcatcher Inn was delighted to have you as a guest. We would definitely choose to stay there if we return to Cambria for a holiday.
reviews.title: It's the place to stay for a whole package of enjoyment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending two nights at the Fogcatcher Inn, I am thoroughly relaxed and rejuvinated!! The hotel is across the street from beautiful Moonstone Beach and a boardwalk that leads all along the coastline.
reviews.title: Fantastically Relaxing and Comfortable! Loved it!!!

likes.disliked: — One loud family who had breakfast the same time as us

reviews.text: Our room was an upstairs King that had a fireplace,a view of the ocean, a microwave and refrigerator, and a nice spacious bathroom. The room was large in size and the bed was really comfy. I loved falling asleep every night listening to the ocean. The fireplace also worked great as a heater.
reviews.title: Totally relaxing Stay

likes.disliked: — the pool temperature, it could have been warmer!

reviews.text: The staff behind the desk was really friendly. They helped us make reservations for dinner both nights and I loved the fresh baked cookies when we checked in.
reviews.title: Loved the Fogcatcher Inn

reviews.text: Breakfast was great. There were eggs and sausages, waffles, pastries, cereal, fruit and many other options. It was nice to not have to forge for breakfast every morning. During breakfast, I was surprised to see how many people were staying at the hotel, because we hardly ever heard or saw anyone else. It was perfect!
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: Next time we come to Cambira, we will definitely stay at the Fogcather again!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay. Across the road from the ocean.

likes.liked: — Close to the ocean - great views.
likes.disliked: — A little costly - you get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped in for one night at the FogCatcher Inn on our drive down the California coast. I cannot recommend it highly enough. Gorgeous fire, great breakfast, checkin made easy. There is a heated pool/spa and with all the inclusions this is a great find for the price.
reviews.title: Can't fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Fogcatcher's Inn for one night on our way back to Los Angeles, CA. What a nice experience after a 5 day road trip us the central coast of California.
reviews.title: Comfortable and serene

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, hotel staff made the check-in process quick and easy. Within 5 mintues, we were checked into our room. Once there, we were pleased with the size and decor of the room. It looked more like a guest cottage at someone's home rather than a hotel room.
reviews.title: Great Inn on the sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a king-size garden view room. It had a fireplace, microwave and small refrigerator.
reviews.title: nice stay despite june gloom

reviews.text: The room was very large and the dressing area was separate from the room, which gave the feel of a room in a home rather than a hotel room.
reviews.title: Just up the coast from us. We simply LOVE this place!

description: The FogCatcher Inn has an Old English feel with contemporary conveniences. With its rounded thatched-style roof, flower-lined brick paths and fireplace in every room, FogCatcher Inn is the perfect romantic getaway. Many of the rooms have fabulous ocean views; whether the surf is crashing or calm and serene, the ocean sets the mood for this unique and memorable hideaway. Rooms are comfortably appointed and amenities include complimentary parking and a continental breakfast. Our Cambria, California, hotel is tailor-made for families, and several pet-friendly rooms are available. Corporate guests and groups find our hotel to be relaxing and rejuvenating and the outdoor pool and spa are idyllic locations to enjoy this part of the Central Coast. Guests of both the Fireside Inn and FogCatcher Inn are invited on the first Friday of each month to attend a wine tasting event featuring local wineries from the 46 West Wine Region. The tasting is held at the FogCatcher Inn along Moonstone Beach Drive. Located just footsteps from Cambria's beautiful Moonstone Beach, the FogCatcher Inn's resident rock-hound experts will carefully inspect treasures collected by kids after beach walks. Each afternoon this summer, poolside classes are offered in how to fold fun towel creations for fans of origami interested in going beyond paper! And the FogCatcher Inn offers families board games for family game nights, coloring books and crayons, puzzles, playing cards and cookies. The FogCatcher Inn welcomes family pets with special treats and VIP (Very-Important-Pet) status. Complimentary breakfasts and in-room refrigerators for guests' snacks and cold drinks combined with 15% savings for bookings at least 21 days in advance or for 3- or 4-night stays, make for great family vacation values.
